prestige.translation[0].definitions[0].d: the respect and admiration that someone or something gets because of their success or important position in society
prestige.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The king wanted to enhance his prestige through war.
This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige.
the personal prestige attached to owning a large property
the prestige of having your work shown at a top London gallery
prestige.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a prestige project, product etc is one of high quality that people respect you for having or being involved in
prestige.translation[2].definitions[0].d: the respect and importance a person, organization, profession, or product has because of their success and high quality
prestige.translation[2].definitions[0].e: The bank lost both money and prestige as a result of the transaction.
Revlon launched a comprehensive marketing program for its prestige brands.
